headline: Gaza airdrops deliver a fraction of what trucks could, aid groups warn
description: Israel’s decision to allow Gaza airdrops to resume comes with risks and high costs, and experts say it’s not enough to meet acute need amid a starvation crisis.

headline: Earthquake off Russia’s coast is among strongest ever recorded
description: The 8.8-magnitude earthquake that struck Russia’s Kamchatka Peninsula could be among the six strongest on record, according to U.S. geological authorities.

headline: 60,000 Gazans have been killed. 18,500 were children. These are their names.
description: Palestinian children have been killed at a rate of more than one per hour since the war began.

headline: Does your city have too much of one kind of tree? That can be a problem.
description: Many urban canopies across U.S. cities are dominated by only a handful of tree types, putting them at risk of being wiped out by an insect or disease.

headline: How AI is impacting 700 professions — and might impact yours
description: Will AI help you work or replace you? Check yourself.

headline: See Trump’s New Tariffs on Every Country
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The president is set to raise taxes on imports arriving from many countries, including India. That’s on top of the tariffs that the White House has already announced on scores of products.

headline: Trump covets rare earth riches, but Greenland plans to mine its own business
description: Interest in Greenland’s minerals is soaring, driven in part by Trump, who has said the U.S. must “get” the island. But the rare earths will be hard to mine.

headline: Gazans are dying of hunger. Here’s what happens to a starving human body.
description: Children suffering under severe food shortages can face lifelong consequences.

headline: Mapping How Mamdani’s Ranked-Choice Strategy Beat Cuomo
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: New data provides the clearest picture yet of how Zohran Mamdani pulled off his primary election upset.

headline: After Surge During Pandemic, Homicides Fall Significantly
label: https://www.nytimes.com/us/
description: An analysis released Thursday by the Council on Criminal Justice shows that the majority of crimes the council tracks are continuing to decrease in 42 U.S. cities.

headline: The War in Gaza Leaves Toxic Legacy of Garbage, Disease and Pollution
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: The bombardment of Gaza has left contaminated soil, blackened water and mounds of garbage spreading disease and pollution; a toxic legacy that will last generations, and extend beyond its borders.

headline: This Was Supposed to Be the Year China Started Catching Up With SpaceX
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: China’s biggest networks have deployed less than 1 percent of their planned satellites, falling far behind SpaceX for dominance in space communications.

headline: All the sparks of one year
label: https://www.scmp.com/hong_kong/
description: After a year of continuous brainstorming, our team is displaying a gallery of 42 visually informative and engaging pages

headline: NYC's Urban Textscape
description: No description available

headline: Coke confirms cane sugar change. RFK Jr. calls it a ‘MAHA win.’ Is it?
description: As Coca-Cola confirms plans to release the cane sugar alternative in the U.S., some nutritionists said there is little health benefit as a replacement for high-fructose corn syrup.

headline: Trump’s tariffs could upend U.S. trade with E.U., a global export power
description: President Trump’s threat to impose 30% tariffs on the European Union disrupted negotiations. From cars to wine, these are the industries in the firing line.

headline: Saving Istanbul’s ancient structures from the next big earthquake
description: Istanbul’s historic buildings, including the Hagia Sophia and Basilica Cistern, are at risk from a major earthquake on the Anatolian fault line.

headline: A new era of floods has arrived. America isn’t prepared.
description: A Washington Post investigation reveals why so few people evacuated in the state hit hardest by last year’s deadliest disaster.

headline: Where Congress’s Cuts Threaten Access to PBS and NPR
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The loss of federal funding threatens scores of public TV and radio stations across the United States.

headline: Trump Insists the Epstein Case Is a Hoax. Here’s What His Supporters Say.
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Their actions range from pressuring the administration to release more information to spinning additional conspiracy theories about the case of Jeffrey Epstein, the convicted sex offender.

headline: How senators voted on the rescissions bill
description: See how your lawmaker voted on the bill that would let the Trump administration pull back billions in foreign aid and other federal funding.

headline: How Every Senator Voted on Bid to Cancel Foreign Aid and Public Media Funding
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The Senate voted 51 to 48 to reclaim spending previously approved by Congress.

headline: Here’s Why There’s So Much Flash Flooding in the U.S. Right Now
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: July’s hot temperatures and moist air are the perfect ingredients for rain.

headline: The White House’s plan to downsize the federal government, in charts
description: An agency-by-agency look at how President Donald Trump and his advisors plan to dramatically shrink the federal government.

headline: Emmy nominations 2025: See our updating list of the best in TV
description: See what surprises and snubs the 2025 Emmy nominations have in store this year.

headline: Who’ll be in Trump’s hero garden? There are a few surprises.
description: Trump’s 2021 executive order named 244 people to include in a garden of American heroes, and $40 million was allotted this month to build it.

headline: Camp Mystic’s leader got a ‘life threatening’ flood alert. They evacuated an hour later.
description: More than an hour passed between Camp Mystic receiving a severe flood warning and a decision to evacuate young campers asleep in cabins by the Guadalupe River.

headline: These are the most and least polluted national parks in the U.S.
description: While haze levels have declined in most national parks, more intense wildfires threaten to reverse this trend. See where your favorite park stands.

headline: Sean Duffy and six others with multiple jobs in Trump’s administration
description: Trump’s vow to shrink the federal government appears to rely, at least in part, on top officials doing multiples jobs. These seven are doing double, triple or quadruple duty.

headline: Kerr County did not use its most far-reaching alert system in deadly Texas floods
description: Local officials used the system more than two days after the recorded height of the floods.

headline: The Wartime Mining Boom Exporting Rare Earths, and Toxins
label: https://www.nytimes.com/world/
description: Unregulated activity led by Chinese enterprises in conflict-ravaged Myanmar is creating an environmental calamity in neighboring Thailand.

headline: Nvidia Becomes First Public Company Worth $4 Trillion
label: https://www.nytimes.com/technology/
description: The A.I. chip maker reached the landmark before Apple and Microsoft, as its value rose more than tenfold after ChatGPT’s release in late 2022.

headline: Camp Mystic Cabins Stood in an ‘Extremely Hazardous’ Floodway
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: An analysis of flood maps shows that several buildings, including those where children were sleeping, were in known hazard zones. A $5 million expansion in 2019 did nothing to alleviate the problem.

headline: Measles Cases Hit Highest Total Since U.S. Eliminated the Disease
label: https://www.nytimes.com/well/
description: Experts worry that if vaccination rates do not improve, deadly outbreaks will become the new normal.

headline: Water vapor July 3 to 4
description: Source: Mid-level water vapor imagery from NOAA's GOES-19 satellite

headline: See When Federal and Local Officials Issued Warnings About the Texas Floods
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The National Weather Service began sending flash flood warnings that should have triggered cellphone alerts a little after 1 a.m., while local officials began posting on Facebook about four hours later.

headline: Bears Will Be Boys
description: No description available

headline: See how FEMA maps reveal camps’ flood risks
description: Many camps in the Guadalupe river region are adjacent or are partially inside high-risk flood zones, according to maps from the Federal Emergency Management Agency.

headline: See How Fast the Floodwaters Rose Along the Guadalupe River
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The speed and intensity of the flooding appeared to take officials by surprise.

headline: How the Assad Regime Built a Mass Grave in Syria
label: https://www.nytimes.com/video/
description: Months after President Bashar al-Assad’s regime was toppled, Charlie Smart, a reporter at The New York Times, traveled to a mass burial site in Syria to understand how the Assad regime hid the bodies of the people it had made disappear.

headline: Foreseeable flaws in Gaza aid project led to shooting of Palestinians
description: The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation program has produced huge crowds near Israeli troops, who opened fire multiple times, according to humanitarian experts, witnesses and visual evidence.

headline: 10-Minute Challenge: An Archery Contest in Ancient India
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: We’d like you to look at one piece of art for 10 minutes, uninterrupted.

headline: Israeli strike hit four areas in notorious Tehran prison. Civilians among the dead.
description: A Post review of satellite imagery and videos revealed damage that pointed to multiple strikes, with structures nearly 2,000 feet apart in ruins.

headline: See How Close the Cabins Were to the River at Camp Mystic
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Many of the missing girls appeared to have been in cabins near the river.

headline: How Will Trump’s Big Bill Affect Your Wallet?
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The wide-ranging domestic policy legislation could impact your taxes, clean energy choices, health care access and more.

headline: 9 Questions About the Republican Megabill, Answered
label: https://www.nytimes.com/upshot/
description: Who benefits, and who gets hurt? How much does it really add to the debt? And what’s the deal with Alaska?

headline: How every House member voted on Trump’s big tax bill
description: See how every lawmaker voted.

headline: See How Each House Member Voted on the President’s Policy Bill
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The House voted 218 to 214 to pass President Trump’s sweeping domestic policy package.

headline: ICE increasingly targets undocumented migrants with no criminal record
description: ICE officers are ramping up arrests. But the share of detained migrants with a criminal conviction has been declining.

headline: Lionel Messi’s free kick: Magic in motion
description: Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo, two of soccer’s biggest stars, have different approaches to one of the game’s most tense moments. Here’s a closer look.

headline: How Syria’s Dictator Buried His Victims
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: A cemetery near Damascus was transformed into an industrial-scale mass grave for Syrians who opposed President Bashar al-Assad.

headline: Tracking Heat Across Europe
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: See detailed maps of the latest temperature forecasts across Europe.

headline: How Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo execute a perfect free kick
description: Two of soccer’s biggest stars have different approaches to one of the game’s most tense moments. Here’s a closer look.

headline: What Is Trump’s Net Worth? Here’s What We Know and Can’t Know.
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Though some aspects of the president’s net worth are murky, it has unmistakably soared in the early months of his second term.

headline: America’s Overheated Landfills Have Been Making People Sick
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: Beneath layers of waste, landfills around the US have been reaching scorching temperatures, spewing toxic gases and geysers of trash juice.

headline: How every senator voted on the reconciliation bill
description: See how each senator voted.

headline: How Every Senator Voted on the G.O.P. Megabill
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The Senate voted 51 to 50 to pass President Trump’s sweeping domestic policy package.

headline: Blackout, Fire Warnings Flashed From Home Sensors Hours Before Crises
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: Leveraging home sensors and AI, Whisker Labs has developed new ways to rapidly track electricity flows to detect grid faults — leaving some power providers trailing
